feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during the Migration of notes with the Migration Object Customer
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

i have the following issue during the migration of texts in the migration object customer. My goal is to migrate texts for customers in a way, so that it is displayed in the notes section of the customer (compare screenshot). The Text should be of the type "accounting note" (Text-ID: 0002).


What i have done so far is, that i filled the fields for the general texts in the migration template. After that i had to edit the mapping in the migration cockpit. The predefined text object (table) seems to be KNA1 (general business partner data), but when i try to map the Text-ID 0002 i get the following error during the simulation: "Text-ID 0002 is invalid for Object KNA1". But when i go into the Business Partner i can add a note with the Text-ID 0002 without a problem.

For the Source Text-ID i used a place holder in the migration template, so "Buchhaltungsnotiz" = "Accounting note". 

After some research i found out, that the Text-IDs are predefined in the Public Cloud, so in my opinion this could only be a problem of a missing assingment between the Text object and the Text ID, but i cant find any customizing setting to change this for the Business Partner. I have only seen settings for the sales areas etc.

My question is, what is the correct Text-ID for this case when i want to migrate accounting notes into the notes section of the general data view of the customers and if it is 0002, what settings do i need to make so this is allowed during the migration.

Best regards 
Lukas

entry.title: aATP - Confirmation Strategies
entry.content:
Hello All 

We are a distribution business with multiple plants and a central DC plant. At present orders are placed with origination plants and then back orders go to the DC plant. The confirmation strategies setup are Gain and with a fall back variant of Improve. Our business approach is that orders from customers are treated equally and work on a first come first served strategy. How would others setup up the confirmation strategies based on our business needs? Should the redistribute strategy be used instead? Keen to hear what others are doing. 

Adam

entry.title: Custom measurement type does not exists in the drop down list in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

My client has requirement to have the rentable object to be calculated in square foot. Hence, i have created Z001 measurement type in Define Measurement Types configuration.

However, in Manage Rentable Object app, under Measurement section, this Z001 still doesn't appear. Anyone can advise?

entry.title: Packing List form issue in public cloud.
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We are in public cloud. We are also using EWM system. For STO scenario, we are posting GI in EWM system, once done data automatically flows to IM system, in Display Outbound Delivery when we check the std form FDP_PACKING_LIST for packing list it is showing item, HU etc, but if we have done line split example posted multiple HUs for 1 line item, system is showing the qty in output form as 0.

Please suggest how we can get the qty correctly for each line in such cases.

entry.title: Condition Records CDS View in Public Cloud
entry.content:

We have create a new condition table in S4H for Sales Pricing and we have added condition records for the same.

Requesting help on the same.

Regards,

Asesh Kumar

entry.title: The capacity required of production order decreases to 0 hour when we start production (receive tran
entry.content:
Hello,


When we start producing a production order and transactions have started (confirmation, good receipt), the required capacity drops to 0.000 hours. This can be seen in the planning tools we use like Capacity Scheduling Table or Manage Work Center Capacity

So, let's take an example. I'm creating a production order that should take 22 hours to produce. I have to start it at 1:00 a.m. and finish it at 11:00 p.m.

Before producing it, I clearly see the required capacity of 22 hours in my various tools. But as soon as I start producing, i.e., making transactions, the required capacity goes from 22 hours to 0.000 hours.

How can I ensure that this required capacity decreases according to the confirmed quantities?

Thank you

entry.title: Language translation for Statutory reports DRC in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello, 

how do you maintain languages for statutory reporting within DRC? Reports are generated in English, if I switch to the local language, only some fields of the reports are translated. Moreover, it seems it is translated by a bot. Where can I maintain correct translations for these statutory reports? Many thanks. I reward kudos

entry.title: Modify the BKPF-WWERT field of the accounting entry in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system.
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good afternoon.

I need to modify the “Conversion date” field. / BKPF-WWERT"  from the accounting entry through a BADI, EXIT, Replacement, Custom Logic, or any other tool in the system SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - ABAP CLOUD. However, I haven't been able to find a way to modify it.

Please, is there any way to modify that value in the FI accounting entry?

 

On the other hand, in the SAP OnPremise version, it was possible to modify it and there were options available. However, in SAP S/4 Cloud, there do not appear to be any options.

 

I look forward to any suggestions or support.

Thank you very much.

@ABAPCloud_Developer 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

ABAP Extensibility 

ABAP Cloud 

FIN (Finance) 

Best regards,

entry.title: Regarding the update of business roles
entry.content:
Assumptions: In our operations, we create business roles by copying existing business role templates. We never add anything to templates or create roles without referencing templates.

Due to a major update, differences have arisen between the business role template and existing business roles. Therefore, we are considering adding the differences in the business catalogs displayed on the next screen of the "Managing Business Role Changes After an Upgrade" app to existing roles as an update process.

Could you please advise what problems might arise if we use this method? Also, please let us know what additional steps we should take in addition to the steps described above?

According to the SAP Help Portal, this is not recommended when there are multiple changes, and I thought there might be some risk in adding multiple catalogs to a business role, so I asked this question.

“We also recommend adjusting your business roles using the Manage Business Roles After an Upgrade app only if one change applies to one business role. If there is more than one change, we recommend making the required changes manually in the Maintain Business Roles app.”

Reference source:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/53e36b5493804bcdb3f6f14de8b487dd/b362b0a1df3a477eb577c1c71c4d43a4.html?locale=en-US

entry.title: Guidance Needed: Creating KPI Report with Graphs and KPI Cards in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP Exports,

I am creating a KPI report based on CDS views and analytical reports. I have tried three options — Generic Drilldown, Analytical List Page, and Data Analyzer and I also created stories. However, the report is not displaying correctly across the three display types and would like to know which option is best for visualizing the entire report in graphical form and for presenting data in KPI cards.

Could you please provide step-by-step instructions for creating a KPI report with graphical visualizations and KPI cards? 

Thank you and kind regards,

entry.title: RAP ABAP Runtime Error – CONVT_NO_NUMBER
entry.content:
Dear All,

While working in the RAP application, we are encountering the following ABAP runtime error: 'CONVERT_NO_NUMBER'.
This occurs when entering a value in the Attach ID field.

It appears the system is attempting to convert a non-numeric value into a numeric type, which is causing the issue. Kindly look into the data type handling or conversion logic in the relevant field or binding.

Your support in resolving this issue is appreciated.

 

 

but my field data type is char32. so please help.

Thanks in advance,

Merve

entry.title: How to pull last 14 digits of IBAN number to the Account ID tag in DME
entry.content:
Hello experts...

Need to pull the last 14 digits of the IBAN to the account Id tag in DME.

Eg:

IBAN: DK7920004374752125

ID: 20004374752125 (last 14 digits of the IBAN).

I have done the config as below: 

conversation function tried both left justified and right justified.

still, it is picking first 14 digits of the IBAN not Last 14 digits.

 

Please help me how to bring last 14 digits (20004374752125) to the Id tag in the DME.

 

Thanks,

Kavitha D

entry.title: Authentification required to access the ATO service
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I am trying to deploy a freestyle SAPUI5 application to our S/4HANA Public Cloud system using Business Application Studio. When I run npm run deploy-config, it prompts me to authenticate in order to access the ATO service (screenshot attached). However, when I enter my S/4HANA Public Cloud development tenant credentials, the authentication fails with the error “Incorrect credentials”—despite entering the correct details.

I am currently using a destination with authentication type set to BasicAuthentication.

I found a similar issue  but seems relevant for On-Premise systems, but I’m not sure which role in S/4HANA Public Cloud provides the ATO-related authorization objects. Additionally, the error message “Incorrect credentials” is misleading, since the credentials are valid for logging into the development tenant.

Has anyone else faced this issue? If so, how did you resolve it?

Thank you!

Best regards,
Karthik

entry.title: Purchase order Percentage Price Condition on Purchase order Item
entry.content:
Hello there lovely SAP Community, 

 

id like to create Purchase orders with Custom Price Condition that is %-Based using the API: 

SAP_COM_0238
 
According to the WSDL the Structure is: 
 
V1:
<PriceCondition>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionType>?</ConditionType>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionAmount currencyCode="?">?</ConditionAmount>
</PriceCondition>
V2:
<PricingCondition>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionType>?</ConditionType>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionTypeName>?</ConditionTypeName>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionRateValue>?</ConditionRateValue>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionCurrency>?</ConditionCurrency>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="?">?</ConditionQuantity>
</PricingCondition>
 
The Price Conditons should look like this: 
 

When i Create the PO with this Payload: (Version2) 

<ItemPrice>
<Amount currencyCode="DKK">100</Amount>
<BaseQuantity unitCode="PCE">1</BaseQuantity>
<!--Zero or more repetitions:-->
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZPB0</ConditionType>
<ConditionRateValue>100</ConditionRateValue>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionCurrency>EUR</ConditionCurrency>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="PCE">1</ConditionQuantity>
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRL1</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->

</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ1</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ2</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
<!-- <ConditionQuantity unitCode="P1">100</ConditionQuantity> -->
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ3</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>
</ItemPrice>

 

The Result looks like this: 

 

 

 

Note that i dont have any %-value. 

How can i set the Price Condition to 10 % ? 

kind regards, 

Philipp

entry.title: 2508 Maintenance Act/Plan app - (WO) descriptions
entry.content: read somewhere in 2508 you can now add descriptions (which for some sort of weird reason are not by default included in apps) yourself. tried it for Maintenance Order Costs - S/4HANA Cloud app but unfortunately not working. am i missing something or others have the same issue? a bit weird from a UX perspective this is not shown by default. no one knows all WO#'s - descriptions is what endusers need for sure. this app is great and has a lot of potential but as many apps not JUST-IT (also not 80/20). keen hear how others cope with this

entry.title: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Why does SAP's procurement process require the asset code to be created and linked at the Purchase Requisition (PR) stage, instead of allowing asset creation after the Goods Receipt (GR)? Wouldn't it be more logical to create the asset code only after confirming receipt and valuation of the asset, rather than at the PR entry stage? Instead why don't we create the asset as an material code and link in the PR?

Regards,

Nithin Pranesh

entry.title: Grouping Multiple Dunning Letters into a Single Notice
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

As part of our dunning letter management process, we would like to know if there is a way to group multiple letters into one based on specific criteria (Accountant clerk for instance).

For context, we manage several customer accounts (~1000) that are handled by the same accountant clerk. To improve efficiency for our collections team and maintain a good relationship with clients, we would like to send a single consolidated letter containing the details of all relevant customer accounts.

When reviewing the "Create Dunning Notices" application, it seems that there is currently only one way to enter the list of Business Partners (BPs). With this setup, we believe that the system generates as many separate dunning letters as there are BPs entered, which is not our intended outcome.

Could you please advise ? 

Thank you for your help.
Best regards.
